thread.title: Check out what to do for entertainment in Lubbock
thread.title_full: Check out what to do for entertainment in Lubbock

author: Staff
title: Check out what to do for entertainment in Lubbock
text:
Check out what to do for entertainment in Lubbock Music Back | Next Robert Cason Element is scheduled to perform at 9 p.m. Friday at Jake's Sports Cafe and Bckroom, 5025 50th St. Back | Next Disney Animated characters Baymax, voiced by Scott Adsit, left, and Hiro Hamada, voiced by Ryan Potter, in a scene from "Big Hero 6." Big Hero 6 is scheduled to play at 8 p.m. Saturday at Maxy Park, 4020 30th St. 
Music 
FRIDAY 
Element — 9 p.m., Jake’s Sports Café and Backroom, 5025 50th St. (806) 687-5253. 
T-Pain — 7:30 p.m., Fair Park Coliseum at the Panhandle-South Plains Fair. Tickets are free and available at 1012 Ave. A. (806) 763-2833. 
Mike Ryan — 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, $8 in advance, $10 at doors for 21+, $12 at doors for 18-20. (806) 741-3031. 
Jeremy Steding — 11 p.m., The Blue Light Live, 1806 Buddy Holly Ave. $8. (806) 762-1185. 
HoneyHoney — 7:30 p.m., The Cactus Theater, 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 762-3233. 
Cooder Graw — 8 p.m., The Office Grill and Sports Bar, 5004 Frankford Ave., (806) 687-6242. 
D.G. Flewellyn — 10 p.m., Cafe J Martini Bar, 2605 19th St. (806) 743-5400. 
Dueling Pianos featuring Kirk Garrett and Rich Wyman — 10:30 p.m., The Cactus Theater. 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. $15. (806) 762-3233. 
Jerry Slater — 7-9 p.m. Mi Taco Village, 220 Regis. BYOB 
SATURDAY 
Metal Elvis — 9 p.m., Jake’s Sports Café and Backroom, 5025 50th St. $5 for 21+, $8 for minors. (806) 687-5253. 
Erick Willis Band — 11 p.m., The Blue Light Live, 1806 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 762-1185. 
Cary Banks and Steve Williams — 8 p.m., Fat Dawg’s Cantina — Mamarita’s 2, 5812, 34th St. (806) 702-8959. 
Zach Newberry — 10 p.m., Cafe J Martini Bar, 2605 19th St. (806) 743-5400. 
Pride of West Texas Show Chorus — 7 p.m., the Cactus Theater, 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. $20. (806) 762-3233. 
Jerry Slater — 7-10 p.m., Rain Uptown, 98th St. and Slide Road. 
TUESDAY 
American Aquarium — 11 p.m., The Blue Light Live, 1806 Buddy Holly Ave. $12. (806) 762-1185. 
WEDNESDAY 
Hunter Hutchinson — 11 p.m., The Blue Light Live, 1806 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 762-1185. 
Buckcherry — 8 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. 
Drew Halcomb & The Neighbors with Penny and Sparrow — 8 p.m., The Cactus Theater, 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 762-3233. 
THURSDAY 
Jacob Furr Band — 11 p.m., The Blue Light Live, 1806 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 762-1185. 
Arts 
FRIDAY 
Museum of Texas Tech — Opens 10 a.m. Friday, 3301 Fourth St. “Ansel Adams, American Master, Selections from the David H. Arrington Collection,” exhibit of 100 original prints by iconic American photographer Ansel Adams. Through Jan. 17. 
Nick Cave in Conversation — 1:30-2:30 p.m., Texas Tech University Student Union Building Ballroom. Visit www.ttuartspractice.org. 
The Art of Helenn Rumpel — 10 a.m.-9 p.m., Museum of Texas Tech, 3301 Fourth St. Open daily from 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Tuesday through Saturday and 1-5 p.m. Sunday. Through Dec. 20. 
133rd First Friday Art Trail — 6-9 p.m. Trolleys will depart at 6:15 p.m. from the following sites: GlassyAlley Art Studio and Gallery, LHUCA, McPherson Cellars and the Tornado Gallery. 
Venues: 
 Art for Goodness Sake — 1808 19th St. First time on the trail. Featured artists: Danny Boyce, photography; Geoff Creswell, pen and ink; Lucy Eusey, acrylic; Manuel Hernandez, charcoal; David Lamb-Vines, acrylic on canvas; Bobby Lee, acrylic on canvas & wood carving; Harvey Madison, photography; Cyndy Nesbit, charcoal; James Scribner, wire sculpture; Darren Shaw, jewelry; Annette Sprouls-Reasoner, oil on canvas; and Jim Stukey, watercolor & charcoal. 771-2727. 
 Buddy Holly Center — 1801 Crickets Ave. Fine Arts Gallery: “Ken Davis: The Landscape Through a Musician’s Eyes,” including scenes from his travels to Europe and South America. Foyer Gallery: “The Campo Santo Suite, Art for Eternity,” Jim Jordon’s photographs taken in northern New Mexico cemeteries. 775-3560. 
 Charles Adams Gallery — 602 Ave. J. Works by Maisie Marie Alford, Shannon Cannings, John Chinn, Joe Clifford, Hannah Dean, Carol Flueckiger, Tina Fuentes, B.C. Gilbert, Lynwood Kreneck, Chad Plunket, Catherine Prose, Ashton Thornhill, Sara Waters, James Watkins, Jeff Wheeler and Jonathan Whitfill. 788-1008. 
 CASP, 5th & J Gallery — 1106 Fifth St. Art by painter Felice House. TTU School of Art Satellite Gallery has the 2015 One Foot Exhibition, featuring work by students and Tech School of Art faculty members. Music by The Goners in courtyard. 788-1008. 
 CASP, Live/Work Studios — 1010 Mac Davis Lane. Studio 1: Art by Jeff Wheeler. Studio 2: Pottery by David Echols. Studio 3/Ron Simons Studio: Michaela Proper, fiber art; Sean Scully, filigree jewelry; and Ron Simons, handmade silver and gold jewelry. Studio 4: Art by Eli Blasko, new artist-in-residence. 788-1008. 
 Giorgio’s Pizza — 1018 Broadway. Art by Angela Vasquez. Music by Dusty Cook. 765-9330. 
 GlassyAlley Art Studio and Gallery — 1940 Texas Ave. Cat Boucher, photography; Harold Browning, mixed media; Rick Harris, metal sculpture; Heather Hedge, mixed media; Hailey Holmes, painter; Cliff Miller, woodworking; Pauline Mills, glass and acrylics; Annette Reasoner, painter; and Elizabeth Sandlin, jewelry. Music by Texas Downunder. 535-2457. 
 J&B Coffee — 2701 26th St. Art by Samantha Wilson. 796-1114. 
 LHUCA — 511 Ave. K. Christine DeVitt Exhibition Hall: “One Way Ride,” exhibit by Glenn Downing. Helen DeVitt Jones Studio: “Reflections,” exhibit by James Watkins. John Lott Gallery: West Texas Watercolor Society’s fall membership show. Martin McDonald Gallery: Solar-powered painting by Carol Flueckiger and her students. Christine DeVitt Icehouse Gallery, 511 Ave. J: “Beyond Borders, Beyond Measure,” photos by Tech Health Sciences Center students studying abroad. LHUCA Warehouse: Art by Eli Blasko, Eric D. Charlton, Joshua Emery, Brett Herron, Trevor King, Lauren Strahl and Xia Zhang. Plaza: Bollywood dance by Yashvi and Anisha. 762-8606. 
 McPherson Cellars — 1615 Texas Ave. Landscape photography by David Sanderson. Show and sale by Llano Estacado Clay Guild. Music by Zoe Carter. 687-9463. 
 Museum of Texas Tech — 3301 Fourth St. “Ansel Adams: American Master, from the David H. Arrington Collection,” with approximately 100 prints of Adams’ photographs loaned to museum by Arrington. “Helen J. Rumpel, Four Decades of Art,” embroidered work, paintings, ceramics. “Antarctica, Pioneering American Explorations of the Frozen Continent.” Museum movie, 6:30 p.m., “Halloween Hustle,” limited to 25 children. Museum concert: 7 p.m., Nataliya Sukhina plays piano pieces that Ansel Adams might have played when training as pianist. 742-2490. 
 Tornado Gallery — 1822 Buddy Holly Ave. Benna Ellis, fused glass; Mark Ploss, oil painting; and Nathan Pollock, painting. 441-8564. 
 Urban Tech/TTU Downtown Center — 1120 Main St. Acrylic paintings by Hayley Crowder. 543-7165. 
 United We Art — 1108 Main St. Timothy Saenz, wood works/image transfers, Gothic; Josh DeMoss, acrylic, Gothic/Modern; and Annette Bingham, watercolor/pen. (512) 657-2425. 
SUNDAY 
Visions of Art at Ransom Canyon — 1-6 p.m., Ransom Canyon, including an exhibit at 91 E. Canyonview Dr. $10. (806) 543-7089. 
Community 
FRIDAY 
Panhandle-South Plains Fair — U.S. 82 Frontage Road, $5-$9. (806) 763-2833. 
Texas Tech School of Art presents the 2015 TASA One Foot Exhibition — 6-9 p.m., TTU Satellite Gallery, 1108 Fifth St., (806) 742-1947. 
“The Good Doctor” — 7:30 p.m., Harral Studio Theatre on the Plainview campus of Wayland Baptist University, 1900 W. Seventh St. $8 for general tickets, $4 for Wayland Baptist Alumni. (806) 291-1060. 
“The Boy Friend” — 7:30 p.m., McDonald Moody Auditorium at Lubbock Christian University, 5601 19th St. 
Jazz and Hip Hop Dance — 5:30-7 p.m. Christmann Dance, 50th Street and Indiana Avenue. Ages 14 and older. $10 for one class or $15 for both. Jazz dance is from 5:30-6:15 p.m., and hip-hop is from 6:15 to 7 p.m. 548-4751. 
Lubbock Area Square and Round Dance Federation — 8 p.m. LASRDF Dance Center, 2305 120th St. Levi and Laces Square Dance Club. 799-1324 and 799-6734. 
SATURDAY 
Big Hero 6: Movie Night at Maxey Park — 8 p.m., Maxey Park, 4020 30th St. (806) 767-3796. 
Susan G. Komen Race For the Cure — 9:30 a.m., Lubbock Memorial Civic Center, 1501 Mac Davis Lane. 
Booksigning — noon-1:30 p.m., Rudy Lane Books in Post. Lubbock authors Kay Ellington and Barbara Brannon will sign copies of “A Wedding at the Paragraph Ranch.” (806) 495-2665. 
SUNDAY 
Wednesday Afternoon Movie at the Museum: The Endurance — 1:30 to 3 p.m., Museum of Texas Tech, 3301 Fourth St., (806) 742-1116. Free. 
MONDAY 
Learn to Dance with Jim and Linda — 6:30 p.m. UMC Activities Center, 5217 82nd St. $5. 783-8829. 
Modern Square Dancing Classes — 7:30-9:30 p.m. LASRDF Dance Center, 2305 120th St. Couples, singles and teens welcome. 799-1324, 799-6734. 
Square Dancing — 7:30-9:30 p.m. Lubbock Area Square and Round Dance Center, 2305 120th St. Teens and older. 799-1324. 
TUESDAY 
Line Dance Vocabulary — 4 p.m. UMC Activities Center, 5217 82nd St. $5. 783-8829. 
Lubbock Area Square and Round Dance Federation — 8 p.m. LASRDF Dance Center, 2305 120th St. Tuesday Rounds Round Dance Club. 799-1324, 799-6734. 
WEDNESDAY 
Diamond Plus Dancers Square Dance Club — 7-10 p.m. Lubbock Area Square & Round Dance Center, 2305 120th St. 765-8736. 
THURSDAY 
“You Can’t Take It With You” — 8 p.m., Texas Tech Maedgen Mainstage Theatre, 2812 18th St. $18 for general admission, $5 for students. 
Lone Star Promen-A-ders — 7-9 p.m. LASRDF Dance Center, 2305 120th St. 799-1324, 765-8736. 
Lubbock Area Square and Round Dance Federation — 7:30-9:30 p.m. LASRDF Dance Center, 2305 120th St. 
Solo Squares Square Dance Club — 799-1324, 799-6734. 
Singing Plainsmen — 7 p.m. Covenant Presbyterian Church 4600 48th St. A barbershop chorus open to men of all ages who like to sing. 445-9119. 
Looking Ahead 
Wade Bowen — Oct. 9, 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, (806) 741-3031. $12 in advance, $15 at doors for 21+, $18 at doors for 18-20. 
Association Lecture — Oct. 9, 10:30 a.m.-12 p.m., Helen DeVitt Jones Sculpture Court and Auditorium, Museum of Texas Tech University, 3301 Fourth St. $7 per lecture or $40 for the whole semester. Kaleidoscope of Choirs — Oct. 9, 7:30 p.m., Hemmle Rectial Hall, 2624 18th St. (806) 834-0939. 
Brandon Adams CD Release — Oct. 9, 11 p.m., The Blue Light Live, 1806 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 762-1185. 
The Music of Joan Jett and the Blackhearts, Pat Benatar, and Heart — Oct. 9 and 16, The Cactus Theater, 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 762-3233. 
Phil Hamilton — Oct. 9, The Office Grill and Sports Bar, 5004 Frankford Ave., (806) 687-6242. 
Early Morning Reign — Oct. 9, 9 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. $5 for 21+, $8 for minors. 
Andy Mineo — Oct. 9, 8 p.m., City Bank Auditorium, 2720 Drive of Champions. $19-$24. 
Grady Spencer with Yellowstone — Oct. 10, 10 p.m., The Blue Light Live, 1806 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 762-1185. 
Craig Elliot — Oct. 13, 7:30 p.m., The Funky Door Wine & Bistro, 6015 82nd Street. Free. 
Aer — Oct. 14, 9 p.m., coHo Nightclub, 2202 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 535-5610. 
Tenth Avenue North, with Sidewalk Prophets and Dan Bremnes — 7 p.m. Oct 15, Calvary Baptist Church 5301 82nd. St. Christian music. Tickets $55-$25. (714) 545-8900 or itickets.com. 
Uncle Lucius — Oct. 15, 7:30 p.m., the Cactus Theater, 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. $15. (806) 762-3233. 
Cokie Roberts: An Insider’s View of Washington, D.C. — Oct. 15, 7 p.m., Texas Tech’s Allen Theatre. $18. Call Select-A-Seat at (806) 770-2000 for tickets. 
Pat Green — Oct. 16, 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, (806) 741-3031. $18 in advance, $20 at doors for 21+, $25 at doors for 18-20. 
Lubbock Symphony Orchestra: Remembrance — Oct. 16 and 17, 7:30 p.m., Civic Center Theatre, 1501 Mac Davis Lane, (806) 775-2242. 
“Smile and Nod: An Old-Fashioned Vaudeville” — Oct. 16 and 17, 7:30 p.m., CATS Playhouse, 2257 34th St. $14 for general admission, $12 for students and seniors. 
“The Boys Next Door” — Oct. 16-17, 23-24, 30-31, 7:30 p.m., Oct. 18, 25, Nov. 1, 2 p.m., Lubbock Community Theatre, 4230 Boston Ave. $20 for general admission, $15 for students. (806) 749-2416. 
Verdi Requiem with LSO, The Lubbock Chorale, and TTU University Choir — Oct. 16-17, 7:30 p.m., Lubbock Memorial Civic Center, 1501 Mac Davis Lane. (806) 770-2000 or (800) 735-1288. 
Mushroomhead and All Falls Down — Oct. 17, 7 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. $21. 
BubbleFest — 10 a.m.-5 p.m., Oct. 17, Science Spectrum, 2579 S. Loop 289. $6.50-$8. (806) 745-2525. 
WWE matches — Oct. 17, 7:30 p.m., United Supermarkets Arena, 1701 Indiana Ave. Card includes John Cena, Seth Rollins, Ryback and Big Show, Dolph Ziggler and Rusev. Reserved seats $107.50 (ringside), $74.75, $58.50, $42.25, $31.25 and $15 (includes service charges) at Select-A-Seat outlets. (806) 770-2000 or (800) 735-1288. 
Tribute to the Eagles, Fleetwood Mac, and the Doobie Brothers — Oct. 17 and 24, 7:30 p.m., the Cactus Theater, 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. $20. (806) 762-3233. 
Plan B — Oct. 17, 9 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. Free. 
Shinedown — Oct. 18, 7 p.m., at the Lone Star Amphitheater, 602 E. 19th St. Breaking Benjamin and Nothing More open. Tickets: $45 (including $5.50 service charge) at Ralph’s Records, 3322 82nd St., and dinproductions.com. (806) 795-3322, (806) 749-2204. 
Colt Ford — Oct. 22, 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, (806) 741-3031. $15 in advance, $20 at doors for 21+, $25 at doors for 18-20. 
Shakey Graves — Oct. 22, 8 p.m., The Cactus Theater, 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. (806) 762-3233. 
One-Eyed Doll — Oct. 22, 8 p.m. Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. 
Roger Creager — Oct. 23, 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, (806) 741-3031. $10 in advance, $12 at doors for 21+, $15 at doors for 18-20. 
Texas Music Icons: A Rockin’ Evening of Dance — Oct. 23 and 24, 8 p.m., Firehouse Theater at LHUCA, 511 Ave. K, $25 for general admission. (806) 770-2000. 
Ian McFeron and Alisa Milner — Oct. 23, 7:15 p.m., Melissa Grimes’ home, 1707 33rd St. General admission is $20. (806) 441-9128. 
Whiskey Myers — Oct. 24, 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, (806) 741-3031. $10 in advance, $12 at doors for 21+, $25 at doors for 18-20. 
Tribute to Guitar Greats — Jimi Hendrix, Santana and Stevie Ray Vaughan — Oct. 24, 7:30 p.m., at the Cactus Theater, 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. $20. (806) 762-3233. 
Cornucopia of Choirs — Oct. 25, 3 p.m., Hemmle Rectial Hall, 2624 18th St. (806) 834-0939. 
Doyle — Oct. 28, 7 p.m. Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. $15 in advance, $20 at the door. 
Pop Evil and Devour the Day — Oct. 29, 7 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. $16. 
Cody Johnson — Oct. 30, 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, (806) 741-3031. $15 in advance, $18 at doors for 21+, $20 at doors for 18-20. 
Prong — 8 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. 
Sam Riggs — Oct. 31, 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, (806) 741-3031. $8 in advance, $10 at doors for 21+, $12 at doors for 18-20. 
Halloween Bash — Oct. 31, 9 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. 
“Craigslisted” — Nov. 2-7, 8 p.m., and Nov. 8, 2 p.m., Texas Tech Maedgen Laboratory Theatre, 2812 18th St. (806) 742-3603. 
The Sword — Nov. 4, 7 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. $13.50. 
USO Dance Party — Nov. 7, 8-11 p.m., Spirit Ranch Pavilion, 701 Regis St. General admission is $25. (806) 770-2000 or (800) 735-1288 for tickets, (806) 762-6201 for information. 
Casey Donahew — Nov. 7, 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, (806) 741-3031. $10 in advance, $12 at doors for 21+, $15 at doors for 18-20. 
Texas Tech Fall Dance Festival — Nov. 12-14, 8 p.m., Tech Creative Movement Studio, southwest corner of Akron Avenue and Glenna Goodacre Boulevard. $10 for general admission, $5 for Tech students. (806) 742-3603. 
Veterans’ Memorial Concert: Matador Singers — Nov. 12, 7:30 p.m., Hemmle Rectial Hall, 2624 18th St. (806) 834-0939. 
Patty Griffin — Nov. 13, 7:30 p.m., the Cactus Theater, 1812 Buddy Holly Ave. $30-$35. (806) 762-3233. 
Manhattan Transfer — Nov. 13, 7 p.m., Texas Tech Allen Theater. $18. (806) 770-2000 or (800) 735-1288. 
“Say Goodnight, Gracie” — Nov. 13, 7:30 p.m., Nov. 14, 2 and 7:30 p.m., Lubbock Memorial Civic Center, 1501 Mac Davis Lane. (806) 770-2000 or (800) 735-1288. 
Zane Williams — Nov. 14, 8 p.m., Wild West, 2216 I-27, (806) 741-3031. $8 in advance, $10 at doors for 21+, $12 at doors for 18-20. 
Allison Weiss and Kid in the Attic — Nov. 19, 7 p.m. Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. $11. 
“Beauty and the Beast” — Nov. 19-21 and 28, 7:30 p.m., Nov. 22 and 29, 2 p.m., Lubbock Memorial Civic Center, 1501 Mac Davis Lane. (806) 770-2000 or (800) 735-1288. $65, $50, $40, and $25. 
Squared Circle Pro Wrestling — Nov. 21, 6 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. $5 over 21, $8 for minors. 
David Berkeley — Nov. 22, 7:15 p.m., Melissa Grimes’ home, 1707 33rd St. General admission is $20. (806) 441-9128. 
Carol Concert — Dec. 1, 8 p.m., Hemmle Rectial Hall, 2624 18th St. (806) 834-0939 or (806) 742-2011. 
Between the Buried and Me — Dec. 4, 7 p.m. at the Lone Star Pavilion, 602 E. 19th St. Enslaved, Intronaut and Native Construct open. Tickets: $24 (includes $4 service charge). at Ralph’s Records and dinproductions.com. (806) 795-3322, (806) 749-2204. 
Messiah: The Lubbock Chorale — Dec. 4, 7:30 p.m., Broadway Church of Christ, 1924 Broadway St. (806) 770-2000. 
“A Christmas Story” — Dec. 4-5, 11-12, 18-19, 7:30 p.m., CATS Playhouse, 2257 34th St. $14 for general admission, $12 for students and seniors. (806) 792-0501. 
Billy Gibbons with the BFGs — 8 p.m., Dec. 5, City Bank Auditorium, 2720 Drive of Champions. $55. (800) 735-1288 or (806) 770-2000. 
Jeff Black — Dec. 6, 7:15 p.m., Melissa Grimes’ home, 1707 33rd St. General admission is $20. (806) 441-9128. 
Machine Head — Dec. 10, 8 p.m., Jake’s Sports Cafe and Backroom, 5025 50th. St., Ste. A. (806) 687-5253. 
Lubbock Symphony Orchestra Holi day Chamber Concert — Dec. 15, 7:30 p.m., St. John’s United Methodist Church, 1501 University Ave. $20 for general admission, and $10 for all students. (806) 762-1688. 
“Ragtime, The Musical” — Dec. 18-19, 7:30 p.m., Lubbock Memorial Civic Center, 1501 Mac Davis Lane. (806) 770-2000 or (800) 735-1288.
